Fields.DialogueText: Léopard, what is our ETA?
Two and a half hours, Capitaine. We should arrive as planned.
You seem perturbed... is something bothering you?

Fields.MenuText: Yes. The world is at war and we have these... these damn Morganas to deal with.
Not really. I'm just waiting for the inevitable Morgana attack.
I'm just tired. I think we all are. Being out here... it's draining, to say the least.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, I agree, Capitaine. But we must trudge on.
We're as prepared as we can be, Capitaine. It's okay to relax just a little.
You must stay positive. What will the crew think if they knew you were talking such rubbish...?
Forget I said anything, Léopard. I was just venting... nothing a little coffee can't fix.
Oh... je suis désolée, Capitaine. You can vent to me... I didn't understand that was what you needed. Umm, coffee?
Don't worry about it. Yes, please. Dark, no sugar.
Even in the clouds you shine through, Capitaine. Here, you go...
Of course we do.
I'll take that as a challenge. Give me two minutes.
@BATTLE
I hate to be the bearer of bad news, but we have uninvited company ahead.
Move to intercept. I'm going to see if I can get this coffee down before we're in firing range.
Léopard!
Where's Léopard? Someone track her down -- I need my sextant and I'm sure she was the last to use it.
*yawn* Were you looking for me, Capitaine?

Fields.MenuText: Sorry if I woke you - but have you seen my sextant? It's not where I usually leave it and I'm positive you were the last to use it.
Off napping somewhere, Léopard? It's the middle of the day... anyway, have you seen my sextant? It's missing.
While I'm working you're napping? That's just wonderful, Léopard... my sextant is gone. Where is it?

Fields.DialogueText: Whoa... calmez-vous. It's over here. I forgot to put it in its case. Sorry, Capitaine.
Umm, I just dozed off... I left it on this bookcase here.
Someone sounds like they need a nap, too. Here. I forgot to put it back in its place. Please, pardon my absent-minded mistake, Capitaine.
Right. Just... promise me you'll put things back where you found them from now on, okay?
Oui, Capitaine. Perhaps we could turn this into a game or system of some sort?
What the heck. Let's hear it.
There's method to my madness, Capitaine. Systems help me organize, which in turn help me remember things...
Noted. And...?
Oh, right. It works as a reward system... if I keep my promise, then I get a reward.
So, to recap - you take things from me, and when you give them back I give you prizes.
How about a ring for keeping a promise? I've always wanted one in gold with a peridot stone. Green like my eyes...
Uh-huh. Keep your promise and I'll think about it.  Maybe.
Oui, Capitaine. Quintant...
I know what it is, Léopard. A quintant is also a sextant, but a sextant is not always a quintant.
You're confusing me now... here are the calculations. See, and I put your quintant back.
See this? Vigorous nod of approval.
@BATTLE
You want to make a game out of returning my stuff? Really?
Exactement!
And you don't see any... imbalances in this plan?
What do you mean?
What do I -?
Okay, say that I own only two things in the world. You then take one of those things. When you return it, I give you the other thing.
Well, that's an oversimplification, but...
What's in it for me?
Capitaine, it's obvious! The satisfaction of making the ship operate more efficiently!
Of course. I should have seen that myself.
In fairness, you're quite overworked.
Ha! What do you want, anyway? What's your idea of a reward?
How about a vigorous nod of approval from your commanding officer?
I can think of nothing better to go with a new ring!
For now, though, I have to get back to what I was doing, Léopard. Since you're here, use the sextant to calculate our longitude.
Does anyone else hear that ticking sound? There.
Umm, I don't hear anything, Capitaine. Are you sure it's from the ship or is it in your head?
Really? No one hears that sound? It's like a ticking clock. Here. Listen here, Léopard... it seems to be coming from one of your boxes.
Ah! Oui. Vous avez plutot raison!

Fields.MenuText: I knew I wasn't going crazy.
See, Léopard... it's not in my head. It was your clock.
A new clock? Need someone to help you find a good spot to display it?

Fields.DialogueText: Just because it wasn't in your head doesn't mean you aren't crazy.
Maybe it wasn't in your head this time, Capitaine. Come on... I'm kidding! Want to see the clock?
Merci! The clock is beautiful... I would love to show you when we have time.
Let's see it. I may have a perfect spot for your clock.
Touch it... it's forged in a pink rose bronze case. Isn't it beautiful? Where do you think we should set it?
It is gorgeous, Léopard - and why not here on the bridge?
I apologize for cutting in, Captain, but duty calls...
Ahh, they must have heard the ticking, too. Ready?
@BATTLE
So, where were we? Oh, yes... what do you think about putting your clock on the bridge?
Hmm... it would give this place some color. Oui, let's do it, Capitaine.
Of course, Léopard. You're always welcome.
I have a new clock and I haven't found a place for it yet. I wound it up and put it back in its box since I couldn't decide where I wanted to put it.
All right, all right... it's not funny if you're not laughing too. I found the clock in Portsmouth - want to see?
Thank you for helping me figure that out. I was beginning to think I would be keeping it in that box forever.
Get to your stations! Dépêchez-vous!
@BATTLE
Léopard, you look a little more dressed up than you do normally... heading somewhere?
You like it?

Fields.MenuText: You look beautiful, Léopard.
I'm sure the vendors will be overjoyed to do business with you.
Honestly, Léopard, you look good in whatever you wear.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad you think so, Capitaine.
You flatter me, Capitaine!
You're making me blush, Capitaine.
Are you going alone or are you meeting friends?
It was something I decided to do at the last minute, so I'll be going alone. Would... you like to join me?
Well, I was just asking... but that sounds nice. Do you mind?
Pas du tout! It would be great to spend time together outside of the ship. And maybe we'll see a gold peridot ring...
Oh, if I'm going to pay you off for not having my things go missing, you're going to need a longer streak than this, my friend.
I keep my promises, Capitaine. You should go shopping before you're put under pressure.
I thrive under pressure, Léopard. *Thrive.* And I'm ready to go if you are.
Always ready, Capitaine. Let's link arms. I want to show you the books I like. And just in case I see that ring, I want you to be by my side.
Heh. Sure, let's go.
The port has organized a little open-air market for us right on the dock. I'm going to buy a book I've had my eye on for a while. Perhaps I'll stop in for tea and sweets as well.
Drills went well, all our equipment has been shined and is looking brand new. Now I can lounge under my 130mm guns with a book...
Not so fast, Léopard.
I've never hosted a ball, either! Can't someone else do it? Sande is reliable and is just as sensible.
Recruit whomever you'd like, but I'm putting you in charge of this list. There's food, drinks, decorations, chairs and tables, place settings, and who knows what else.
D'accord, Capitaine. I guess that spot under my beloved guns must wait...

Fields.MenuText: You're entitled to complain, but I do expect this to be done with your usual efficiency and care.
No quibbling. Do your task with honor, Léopard.
I'll help as much as I can, for what it's worth. Just do your best.

Fields.DialogueText: I will do my duty as I always do, Capitaine. To the highest degree one can only dream to achieve.
These complaints are only steam to my abilities, Capitaine. I am merely using all of my efforts to propel me toward excellence.
Capitaine, my contempt will be kept at a quiet minimum. As for my effectiveness, that is never called into questionno matter the task.
For what it's worth, we've already been supplied with decorations - in theory, all you need is in these boxes.
We've been assigned decorations? I thought I was going to be in charge of it all... including buying decor.
Yeah, I want as little of this as possible coming out of our budget.
Really, Capitaine? And you couldn't think of anyone else fit for this task? I don't know if I should be offended...
You shouldn't. I need you to do this because it's important, even if it's... not a duty I would have volunteered for, and because nobody could do a better job than you.
... You're very good. I came very close to thanking you for making me do this.
@BATTLE
There's no easy way to say this - a particularly unusual set of orders has just been confirmed.
And why is that not easy to say?
Because I'm gritting my teeth as I talk.
Ah. Je comprends.
We are going to be receiving and hosting an international delegation. We will not only be keeping them safe. We will not only be "entertaining" them. We will be hosting a ball.
Because, apparently, if we're going to attract support for a campaign against an unprecedented threat to global security we need formal dance parties for industrialists and admirals. On warships.
Calmez-vous, Capitaine! It sounds like fun - and good for crew morale as much as anything else.
I'm glad you think so - because I need you to take point on organizing it. It's not my forte and you know this ship inside and out.
What.
Glad to see we're on the same page.
As far as I know, *nobody* on this ship has hosted a ball. But you have a fantastic sense of aesthetics, and nobody else knows how people move around this ship the way you do.
The vendors we're using for the food and drink have already been chosen as well. Don't worry - it's all there on the list.
Heh.
Get to your stations!
@BATTLE
Now, back to the list. I'm going to need to borrow this... and this... oh, and this...
Wait, what are you doing with all of my things, Léopard?
I'll bring them back and put them where I previously found them. I need them as decorations for the ball.

Fields.MenuText: I would appreciate it if you would ask first, Léopard. It's rude to just take things.
Sure, but care for my items as if they were your own.
Nope. Nuh-uh.

Fields.DialogueText: Sorry, Capitaine. I thought it would be fine. It would really help speed up decorating... please?
Of course, Capitaine. I apologize. I was on task and didn't even think to ask first...
Oh, come on. Capitaine, I'll put them back... you know this.
Right. To be clear, are you proposing to take any of my day-to-day clothing? Or my toothbrush? Or anything else that could be considered either personal or essential?
I truly am sorry, Capitaine. I will be sure to ask the next time around. And, I will put everything back in its place when I am done.
Thank you, Léopard. Perhaps this is your first true test for this game of yours.
Non. Not at all!
Well, I asked for this...
Okay, there's no sense in making you unpack it all. Carry on.
Léopard. I need you to meet me in the mess hall, now.
Umm, oui? What's the problem, Capitaine?
In the last two hours I've received five increasingly panicked transmissions from Command. Not about Morganas, I should stress. Oh, no!
Calmez-vous, Capitaine... there's still time to figure something out. Why didn't you have a backup in place?

Fields.MenuText: Backup? What do I look like... a party planner?
I had three backups. It's been an uncommonly bad week.
I'm about as calm as I care to be, frankly. And let's save the rigorous self-examination until after this mess is dealt with.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmm... let's take a breath. I have an idea, so there's no reason to be worked up.
Relax, there's plenty of time and I may have something in mind.
Fine. Work yourself up and use excess energy... but can you spare some of the energy for listening to a plan I have?
What do you think I called you in here for? Come on, now... what are you thinking?
It just so happens one of the officers used to work in a certain grand hotel in Paris, and knows a thing or two about hosting decadent parties.
Heh. I enjoy that idea a lot more than I probably should.
*ALARM*
Ugh, damn it.  There's the alarm. The Morganas never fail to show up when chaos is imminent. Ready?
Capitaine.
@BATTLE
That helped me let off some steam. Léopard, I'm sorry for lashing out. I noticed the decorations you've put up so far. They look wonderful...
Ne vous en faites pas. Sometimes we have to let it all out. And thank you, Capitaine. I'm excited for you to see it all when I'm finished.
As am I, Léopard. Before we waste any more time, contact the officer.
Hah! I'm sure it'll work out just fine, Capitaine.
Are you about to complain about the ball again?
I am an officer with an assignment. I don't complain about it.
But, yes. The chef de cuisine that had been selected for the ball is apparently violently ill, and it's now down to us to find a replacement.
Because of course it is. And we can't use our normal cooking staff because this has to be "special."
... Is there anything around for us to shoot?
I will talk to him - and, if that falls through, canned meat on crackers will have to do.
I'll think of another arrangement, just in case. I'd hate to waste our supply of canned meat and crackers.
Well, I am officially impressed with the decorations - and I have no idea how you're going to keep track of them all.
Oui, je viens de finir! Oh, Capitaine... you will be pleased.
That's fantastic, Léopard. I may have to look into finding that ring after all.
I am determined, Capitaine. Oh, and I have great news! We will eat well on the night of the ball - no canned meat and crackers.

Fields.MenuText: Which means, in turn, we're probably not going to be given Arctic patrol duty for the next eighteen months. Thank you.
I knew I could count on you, Léopard. We're just around the corner from calling this a win.
That is great news - but don't celebrate too early. As we're well aware, anyone can fall ill at any time.

Fields.DialogueText: I wasn't sure if the officer's contacts would pull through, but they did. We are so close to making this night great.
I knew everything would work out, Capitaine.
Calmez-vous, Capitaine. I promise -- everything will work out.
Thank you, Léopard... how does the rest of the list look?
I'm nearly finished. Really, you had most of the work done already. All I had to do was check it off the list.
Once you're done with that list, do you think you could help me organize here on the bridge?
Of course, Capitaine.
@BATTLE
Are you done, then? Are they all up?
And yes, I do keep track. See here... I made a list to be sure.
Sande, I need you to take this list and make sure all of the food and drinks are accounted for. Oh, and to take one last look around for anything that may need touching up.
Yes, Léopard.
It looks like you're about 99% of the way to pulling off a miracle, Léopard.
Oh, I'll take whatever you choose to give me, Capitaine...
*ALARM*
VRAIMENT?
Let's get this over with - we still need a little time to prep for the event.
@BATTLE
Sande, is Léopard ready yet? She's fast on her feet to battle, but she certainly takes her time getting ready for a party.
She should be just about ready, Captain.
Looking for me? I had a hard time locating my rouge, but it couldn't evade me in the end. Do you like it?

Fields.MenuText: You look wonderful, Léopard...
Meh... it's a bit much. Red makes you look a little intense - but you look beautiful nonetheless.
There hasn't been a day I've seen you looking less than gorgeous, Léopard.

Fields.DialogueText: My favorite rouge does do wonders.
Oh, hush. It's not something I like to wear all of the time, but it seemed appropriate for this event.
I hate wearing this goop, but my look comes together with the pop of color.
You look magnificent, Léopard. People will notice.
Thank you, Sande. You are too kind. And thank you for all of your hard work.
For the record, Léopard, Sande was right - you look spectacular.
I'm always ready, Capitaine...
"Miracle" is excessive, I think.
Just take the compliment.
Better now than later. Where are they?
About... thirty kilometers to the west.
Seconded, Sande. Now, get yourself to the big event before we run out of champagne - Léopard and I will catch up in a second.
Au revoir!
Et vous aussi, Capitaine.
So. Are you ready, maîtresse du navire?
What's in your hand, Léopard? Do you mind if I take a look?
Comment vous dites? In my hand?
Oh, that's odd. I could have sworn I saw you holding something shiny.
I think my nails might have just caught the light. I do love this color.
I've never noticed how delicate your hands are, Léopard.
They are somewhat small. I don't mind, though - I've learned to work around it.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure it's only made you more resourceful.
It wasn't a criticism. I think your hands are lovely.
I would think you capable of anything you set your mind to, regardless of the size of your hands.

Fields.DialogueText: I would say I agree with you, Capitaine.
Well... merci!
I'd agree with you on that count, Capitaine.
Why the sudden interest in my hands, Capitaine?
I've made you uncomfortable.
Nom de Dieu, now? Really?!
Ah, well. Let's put some dirt on those hands, Léopard.
Ha, ha... with you, always, Capitaine.
@BATTLE
Non. By all means, talk about my hands!
I don't know. When I talk about beautiful things - things that make me happy - it always seems to invite...
*ALARM*
The crew's still talking about the ball...
I think I underestimated how good it would be for morale.
Oh, Capitaine, they loved it! The food was exceptional and the decorations were quite the sight - if I do say so myself.

Fields.MenuText: Please, say so yourself. You earned it.
Yes, yes. Despite the complaining, your work excelled.
You were the reason that ball was a success, Léopard... I want you to know I appreciate you and the work that you do.

Fields.DialogueText: I want to apologize for grumbling about the work earlier. It turned out to be a really fun task.
I don't think I complained that much.
I know, I know. We make a great team.
*ALARM*
Well, let's put our heads together - enemies ahead.
@BATTLE
Phew. That was a workout.
Tell me about it. I could use a drink. Would you like to have tea with me, Léopard?
I am thirsty, now that I think about it. Please, do you have...
Mint green tea? Of course.
... Oui, Capitaine. Merci.
Don't thank me until you've tasted it.
Fair point. Despite *my* complaints, you did a magnificent job.
Ha!
Ha!
Sande, could you do me a favor? Feel free to say no - it's nothing to do with your duties or the war.
Ah, I see... she's kept her word, hasn't she?
Yeah. And, more than that, I think she deserves...
What do I deserve? What are we talking about?

Fields.MenuText: Oh, hello, Léopard... I didn't see you there. It was nothing.
Everything you think you heard is probably wrong. Think about it.
Hi, Léopard... we were just talking about you.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmm, I see that it is something you don't want to share.
Why are you acting strange?
It's okay... I don't have to know what you're planning. I'm sure I'll find out, eventually.
Sande, inform me when you've completed that task. You are excused.
Captain. And Léopard.
Have fun with whatever you're doing!
Capitaine, I have something for you. I found it a while ago and meant to give it to you.
Oh. That's a pretty box... is this oak? It's quite ornate.
Ouvrez-le! The box isn't the gift, Capitaine.
I knew that.
Don't worry about that, Capitaine. I hope you like it. You do a lot for me... for all of us here.
Thank you, Léopard. I love it.
*ALARM*
The pleasure is mine.
@BATTLE
Well, now I'm just intrigued.
It's a surprise for Léopard. Details are in this envelope - if you're willing, I'd ask that you keep quiet about it.
A watch? Léopard, this looks expensive - I couldn't...
Capitaine, the barometric pressure indicates a storm of the supernatural variety is rolling in.
I see. Sande, get to the radio and pass along our current position and Léopard's calculations.
Yes, Captain.
Je vais avertir l'équipage. Winds are beginning to pick up... it looks like a nasty one.
*ALARM*
Damn. I don't think the crew need to be warned anymore.
I'll let them know about the weather, at least. I'm afraid the storm will hit us before the enemy does.
@BATTLE
Their ability to appear out of thin air is uncanny.
Ha, but we're always ready for them, Capitaine.

Fields.MenuText: It's okay. If we skirt along to the south, we should make it out of this thing unscathed.

Fields.DialogueText: Oui, Capitaine.
A word of warning, though - I think this storm system is quite extensive...

Fields.MenuText: Nothing we can do about it but push on through.
If it's not natural, that means the Morganas want the region locked down for a reason - and we need to investigate.

Fields.DialogueText: Sande, take a look at this.
Hmm... I'm not sure what I am looking at. All I see is a huge mass in the water... oh! An eye.
Yes, that's a whale. They're magnificent, aren't they?
I've only read about whales in books. You're right, they're... impressive, up close.
Capitaine, would you like to take a peek?

Fields.MenuText: I've seen many in my lifetime, Leopard. When you've seen one, you've seen them all.
Thanks - but I don't get to be in sightseeing mode when there's work to be done.
Please stop tempting me to put down the paperwork. I might never pick it back up.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, come on, Capitaine. Live a little... share this moment with me.
Does it hurt to slow down and appreciate sealife once in a while? I don't think so...
Well, if you do decide to take a peek at these wondrous animals in their natural habitat, I hope it's with me.
Okay, okay. Give me a look.
Can you imagine trying to hunt one of those? What a catch!
Besides, I think we have more urgent prey. See `em?
Malheureusement... oui. I'll meet you on the bridge!
@BATTLE
Bien!
Boy. I'd forgotten how big those beasts can get.
You still mean "hunting" in the sense of getting close enough to touch the prey?
Oui.
Then let's save that for after the war.
Léopard, I hear sirens. What's going on?
There's a fire, Capitaine. The crew is getting it under control...
A fire? What in the world... how did that come about?
Calm down, Capitaine. It was a little mishap, but it's being taken care of.

Fields.MenuText: Léopard, don't beat around the bush. What happened down there?
Worry less about covering for the crew and more about telling me what I need to know. Please.
That wasn't my question, Léopard. How did the fire start?

Fields.DialogueText: Is it really necessary to say? The fire is nearly outthe ship is fine and everyone is safe, that's what matters.
Capitaine, I may be speaking out of rank... but it was just a mistake. No harm was done to the ship.
Don't lose your head, Capitaine. It was a small fire and the crew handled it in haste.
*ALARM*
Damn. We'll continue this after we deal with these... these timely intruders.
@BATTLE
Well, I have prior arrangements and I'm running late, so...
Wait a minute. Not so fast, Léopard. You can leave after you tell me what happened earlier.
One of the deckhands fell asleep with a cigarette and then, you know... fire. But it was taken care of swiftly. Capitaine, I will speak to him.
See that you do. And make it clear that if there's a next time *I'll* do the talking.
Oui, Capitaine. Of course. I will speak to him and be sure it never happens again.
You shouldn't leave before I have a chance to thank you!
Oh, well.
Sande, how's the search for the... you know?
Oh, yes. I have located a ring in the size that you indicated, but it has diamond accents.
Is the center stone peridot? She specifically spoke of a peridot set in a gold ring.
Yes, Captain. It is set in gold and the main stone is peridot - with the aforementioned diamond accents.
It's beautiful. The diamonds don't take away from the brilliance of the peridot. I really think you'll be pleased.
I'm very much in your debt, Sande. Thank you.
Of course, Captain - my pleasure. The ring should be here soon.
Excellent. She should be back from drills anytime now, so...
Hello! What a wonderful day. Isn't it just so pleasant?
Welcome back. It certainly is... how were drills?
Fantastiques. We're like a well-oiled engine. We've gotten to the point where we move in such synchronicity that it's as if we're dancing. A show to see, to be sure.

Fields.MenuText: I really need to make a point of watching them one of these days. It's been a while.
Interesting. A show you say? Is that an invitation?
You know, I'd really like to watch one of these drills from start to finish. What do you say?

Fields.DialogueText: You'd be more than welcome, as always.
I don't see why not. You'd be proud, Capitaine.
Really? I would have invited you sooner had I known, Capitaine.
Perfect. I'll surprise you sometime in the future.
Ah, a surprise. I should've seen that one coming. Well, it makes no difference. I am confident in the crew's ability to handle your presence, Capitaine.
*ALARM*
I have no doubt, Léopard.
@BATTLE
Get to your stations! Dépêchez-vous!
@BATTLE
Captain, I have a note for you...
I need you to hold onto that for a little while longer, Sande. I'm in the middle of something.
If you want, Captain. But it's regarding a certain task...
Well, that sounds ominous. What's gone wrong?
Here... it's best you read it.
Hm. They're not very specific about the length of the delay, are they?
No, but it shouldn't be too much longer.

Fields.MenuText: What? Why didn't you inform me?
Sande. I need you to look into my eyes and understand just how unamused I am.
Sande... this isn't a military matter, but it *is* costing me a small fortune.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sorry, Captain. I meant to tell you but got caught up in other affairs on board. It shall be here, soon...
It was what I had to do to get it done. I do apologize for taking it into my own hands.
I know, I know. I shouldn't have, but it was out of the best of intentions, Captain.
I'm planning on presenting it to Léopard the day I watch the drills...
Yes, Captain. Léopard and I got to chatting and she mentioned the game you two are playing... she also told me her ring size. And we were off by just a little - but it can be fixed.
Fair enough - and, thank you. It was the right call.
I appreciate it, Captain. Where *is* Léopard?
She's having tea with some of the midshipmen - so hopefully she's not listening in.
No, Captain. Permission to go find something to eat?
Granted. And, Sande - thank you. I couldn't do this without your help. I'll be sure to let Léopard know how much work you've done.
Don't worry about it, Captain - I like shopping with other people's money.
... The thing is, I went ahead without your consultation and had them tweak the size of the ring.
Never mind. What prompted your intervention?
Huh. Do you think she knows what we're up to?
No, Captain. I think she just thinks about that ring a lot.
Anything else, Sande?
And I think the lady of the ship will be very happy with the gesture - for whatever that's worth.
What are you reading, Capitaine? You're awfully quiet...
Oh, I didn't see you there, Léopard... it's nothing. I'm just thinking.
Okay... would you like to talk? I brought some mint tea, let's chat.

Fields.MenuText: Thank you, Léopard. I'll take a cup... I'm thinking about the current state of the war, more or less.
I'm sorry - I just can't afford to take a break right now. But I do appreciate your concern.
If you don't mind me being terrible, distracted company...

Fields.DialogueText: I'm here for you either way, Capitaine.
If you change your mind, just let me know.
Nonsense. You'll be delightful distracted company.
*ALARM*
There's no rest with these Morganas.
Their timing is impeccable. And annoying...
@BATTLE
Well, that helped me blow off some steam. How are you doing today, Léopard?
Enh - je vais bien. How are you?
Just one of those days, Léopard. I can't help but note that you've kept your promise thus far.
I have... I do enjoy this ''game.'' And I'm looking forward to receiving my prize once all is said and done.
Ha, ha... but you haven't won yet.
Really, I win whether or not I get the prize. A system has been put in place.
It is a good system. I'm happy it's working out so well for both of us.
You look a little happier now, Capitaine.
I feel better. Thank you. Just talking to you was enough to lift my spirits.
And that makes me happy, Capitaine.
Well, see, now I'm just going to sit here smiling at you until you tell me to stop.
That could take a while, Capitaine.
Get to your stations!
@BATTLE
That was a little rough. What did you think, Léopard?
I agree, Capitaine. It seemed as if our crew lagged a bit mid-battle. Should we implement any new tactics or revisit any of our current methods to remedy the problem?

Fields.MenuText: I think it might be worth reviewing our fire drills. I think that's where I sensed some lag.
No. I think the crew is worn out as it is. Perhaps they need some R&R.
I don't think I've seen a real pattern of inefficient behavior. We'll see how they do in the next battle.

Fields.DialogueText: I agree, Capitaine.
I don't know. I think we shouldn't act in haste - but you are the capitaine of this ship.
Well, I guess so... things can always be improved upon.
Well, let's work from that assumption. I'd appreciate it if you'd keep tabs on the crew and let me know if we need to change course.
We should make reviewing our drills and strategies a habit. We will be better prepared if we do.
And I was looking for a new hobby, too.
Of course, Capitaine. I have many books on strategy, and I am sure we'll find some means of improvement. And if a birdie sings to me another way, I'll be sure to take notes.
Ha!
And I'm staring at you again. Sorry.
I was staring back. It's all good.
Anyway! Yes! Reviewing drills and strategies!
Well, well...
Look at this here.
Qu'est-ce que c'est? Ooh, what's in the bag, Capitaine?

Fields.MenuText: Umm... oh, it's nothing, Léopard. Just a little something I found.
Oh, yes... I mean, no. It isn't something that you'd find any interest in.
Hi, Léopard... you're a little too stealthy for your own good, you know that?

Fields.DialogueText: You're acting a bit odd... can I see?
Okay... you don't want to share what's in that bag, do you?
Hmm... are you hiding something from me?
No. I'm saving this for another day. Thank you for asking, Léopard.
*ALARM*
Saved by the Morganas. Starboard.
Ha. Bien sûr, bien sûr.
@BATTLE
The crew has benefitted from the changes we've implemented. I'm proud of them.
I can see a difference, Léopard. Your help has really made an impact.
I'm glad that you're able to see it as well.
Well, I have a few things I have to see to... don't you have drills soon?
Oui, Capitaine. Au revoir!
Hmm...
Sande, Léopard's meeting with her tea circle, so let's use this time to look over the ring.
Ah, yes. I'm glad you didn't blow the surprise...

Fields.MenuText: I'm not sure that I didn't, to be honest. I think she's catching on.
Yes, she'll be surprised. I don't think she has any clue.
I really hope I didn't... but at this point, I can only hope.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, don't worry too much about it, Captain.
I think she will be happy whether or not she is surprised.
We've made it this far, we must keep moving forward.
I just hope the ring itself is a success. And I hope it's not too overwhelming a gesture.
If you don't mind me asking... what exactly is your purpose in giving her this ring, Captain? I am starting to think there might be more to this than what I initially thought.
I don't think that would be the most productive conversation you've ever...
Bonjour! I'm back a little early. It started to rain and I didn't want to get my new coat wet.
OH! Hi, Léopard.
Hi... did I catch you both at a bad time? I can leave if you'd like...
No, not at all, Léopard. Sande was just leaving. Weren't you, Sande?
Yes, Captain. Nice seeing you, Léopard. I have to go... wash my hair. Bye.
You should get some fresh air too, Capitaine... you're beginning to act really strange.
*ALARM*
What perfect timing.
@BATTLE
I think we both know I've been acting really strange for most of my...
Sande, I have a plan. I'm going to entrust you with the ring. I can't keep it in my quarters - Léopard's nosy enough, she'd find it within hours. And I can't risk losing it in battle.
Hold onto it until drills. I'll present the ring to Léopard immediately after.
Will do, Captain.
You're dismissed with your captain's thanks. I need to get back to the reports.
Noted. I'll see you later, Captain.
And keep it safe, Sande.
I will.
What was that about?
Léopard, what have I told you about being overly stealthy?
I think I just know what you mean to say better than you do. Anyway, since we're on the subject of surprise...

Fields.MenuText: Surprise? What surprise?
Umm, there's no surprise, Léopard... Sande has just been helping me with some things.
Actually, I think we're on the subject of what I find exciting and delightful.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmm... strange. You're acting more bizarre by the minute.
I don't know if you are just coming off strange or if you are actually strange.
Okay, Capitaine. Whatever you say...
*ALARM*
Damn it. Here we go again.
No need to worry, Capitaine. We'll put these Morganas to flight in no time.
@BATTLE
That you find it exciting and delightful?
I think that's a fairly wild reinterpretation of my actual words.
Captain, I need to talk to you... alone.
Eh, bien... I have to go out and replenish my tea. Bye, Sande...  Capitaine.
I'm sorry to be keeping you waiting so long. It's been a lot harder to make time for the drills than I'd hoped.
It doesn't matter. I just... I have some dreadful news. Please, forgive me.
Please don't tell me you lost it.
I'm sorry, Captain. I've been looking all over for it. But with all of my work and managing this surprise, my mind has left me. I'm so sorry!

Fields.MenuText: I can't be mad at you, Sande.
Are you kidding me? YOU HAD ONE JOB!
Stop. This is my own damn fault.

Fields.DialogueText: Ugh... I'm so sorry, Captain. I will find it. I promise...
It's not my fault... I mean it is, b-but I never asked to help with something outside of my duties.
Captain, I will find it. I just need some time...
Okay. Relax. I'm going to come up with a plan.
Yes, Captain.
Sorry to interrupt your meeting, but we have company. They're coming in from the north.
Here we go.
@BATTLE
Now that that's over, you two can get back to whatever you were talking about...
It's okay. Sande, go get something to eat. I'll catch up with you later.
Thanks, Captain. I'll... see the two of you later.
CAPTAIN! ALL IS WELL!
Really? What a relief. Thank you, Sande.
Woohoo? Ha, ha. Whatever you two are planning... it's certainly caused you both some distress. I'm happy to see you both happy once again.
Well, I have other engagements to attend to, so I must go.
Bye, Sande. Thank you.
Do you care to share what it is you two are celebrating?

Fields.MenuText: I don't know what you mean, Léopard...
Oh, yes... there is much to celebrate, Léopard. But no... I cannot share our plans.
No, nothing to share.

Fields.DialogueText: I figured you wouldn't share. But whatever it is, I will find out.
Hmm... your secrecy is beginning to get on my nerves.
All right... but like I've told you before, Capitaine... I am here if you need me.
*ALARM*
Well, isn't that a timely invitation? I need you right now. The waves have brought in Morganas - portside.
@BATTLE
That was fast. The crew has been on a roll since we altered their training.
Thank you, Léopard. I'm proud of you... and of the crew.
You don't have to tell me, Capitaine. I know.
Oh, I believe it. It is *hard* to hide anything from you on this ship.
How do you know that I don't know what you're hiding from me?
I don't... but if you do know, you hide it quite well, Miss Léopard.
*wink*
Get to your stations! Vite!
@BATTLE
Are you ready, Sande? Do you have the ring?
I do, Captain. Are you nervous?
Let's call that classified information. Let's go.
Bonjour! Did you both enjoy the show?
Yes, of course.
You and the crew did wonderfully, Léopard.
I have something for you, Léopard. You mean a lot to me and I know this started as a game, but it's grown to be much more than that to me.
Capitaine? I don't know if I should be scared or excited...

Fields.MenuText: Léopard, I have this ring for you. I hope that it's just what you pictured.
Don't be scared, Léopard. Take this ring as a symbol of my dedication to you...
I don't know if this works, but here...

Fields.DialogueText: OH! It's beautiful... it's more beautiful than I could have imagined. Oh, my goodness, Capitaine.
This... this is beautiful! Capitaine, how lovely!
I knew all along that this was what you two had going on! Oh, I'm so thrilled!
Sande helped me in my mission. I couldn't have done this without him...
I know. I had a feeling that this was what you both were up to. And I realized something.
What's that?
I really don't like being kept out of the loop.
Ha! I hope all of this didn't cause you as much anxiety as it did us...
No. I am so happy. I love it, Capitaine. This means so much to me.
As it does to me.
Shall I try it on? Would you like an excuse to stare at my hands again?
Well, this is getting... um...
Dismissed.
Thank God.
I don't just like looking at your hands, you know.
Well, then. We'll have to find more kinds of jewelry for you to examine, won't we?
You really like pushing your luck, don't you?
Ha!
